Which three RADIUS attributes must be supplied by the RADIUS server to enable successful VLAN allocation? (Choose three.)

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

Examine the FortiManager information shown in the exhibit.
Which two statements about the FortiManager status are true? (Choose two.)

choices.C: FortiSwitch manager is working in central management mode.
choices.A: FortiSwitch manager is working in per-device management mode.

choices.C: The FortiGate ARP table is missing entries.
choices.D: Access VLAN is enabled on the VLAN.
choices.A: The native VLAN configured on the ports is incorrect.
choices.B: The FortiSwitch MAC address table is missing entries.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is testing the connectivity for a new VLAN. The devices in the VLAN are connected to a FortiSwitch device that is managed by FortiGate. Quarantine is disabled on FortiGate.
While testing, the administrator noticed that devices can ping FortiGate and FortiGate can ping the devices. The administrator also noticed that inter-VLAN communication works. However, intra-VLAN communication does not work.
Which scenario is likely to cause this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
page 224 of study guide

confermo la C a pagina 209

C, as per p. 209 study guide

Selected Answer: C
page 209 of study guide

choices.C: To restrict the IP address assignment to FortiSwitch and FortiExtender devices
choices.D: To restrict the IP address assignment to devices that have FortiSwitch or FortiExtender as their hostname
choices.A: To ignore DHCP requests coming from FortiSwitch and FortiExtender devices
choices.B: To reserve IP addresses for FortiSwitch and FortiExtender devices

choices.C: Verify that the SSID to an AP group that should be broadcasting the SSID is applied.
choices.A: Verify that the broadcast SSID option is enabled in the SSID configuration.
choices.B: Verify that the Block Intra-SSID Traffic (Intra-vap-privacy) option in the SSID configuration is disabled.
choices.D: Verify that the SSID is manually applied on AP profiles for both 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz radios.

questions.question_text:
An administrator has configured an SSID in bridge mode for corporate employees. All APs are online and provisioned using default AP profiles. Employees are unable to locate the SSID to connect.
Which two configurations can the administrator verify? (Choose two.)
